author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Computers are useless.  They can only give you answers.

author: Unknown
quote: If carpenters made buildings the way programmers make programs, the first woodpecker to come along would destroy all of civilization.

author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quote: Computing science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.

author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quote: I donâ€™t need to waste my time with a computer just because I am a computer scientist.

author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quote: It is practically impossible to teach good programming style to students that have had prior exposure to BASIC: as potential programmers they are mentally mutilated beyond hope of regeneration.

author: Richard Hamming
quote: The purpose of computing is insight, not numbers.

author: Donald Knuth
quote: An algorithm must be seen to be believed.

author: Donald Knuth
quote: People think that computer science is the art of geniuses but the actual reality is the opposite, just many people doing things that build on each other, like a wall of mini stones.

author: Alan J. Perlis
quote: It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than vice versa.

author: Alan Turing
quote: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.

author: Fred Brooks
quote: Einstein argued that there must be simplified explanations of nature, because God is not capricious or arbitrary. No such faith comforts the software engineer.

author: Alan Kay
quote: Simple things should be simple; complex things should be possible.

author: Alan J. Perlis
quote: It is easier to write an incorrect program than understand a correct one.

author: Brian W. Kernighan
quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
